body: @CaiyuZhang to generalize to new images you need to train on full COCO, not 4 images. The tutorials are only for demonstration of how to start training a custom dataset, their results will not generalize at all.
@glenn-jocher Thanks,  I know several images cannot generalize to new imges.  I just want to know my issue is a bug or simply doesnot detect object due to not enough train images.

@CaiyuZhang if you train on 4 images, you can only then detect on these same 4 images. This is what the tutorials do, simply to show a quick training process. Actual training requires many images (i.e. hundreds or thousands of example images) to be able to generalize to new images.

@glenn-jocher My English is not so good, maybe my expression is not so clear. I mean train few images definitly have terrible performsnce, but I thought it should output wrong box not none box. So I thought I maybe ran into a bug. according to ur reply, if this model cannot detect objects, then it should output none box, rightï¼Ÿ
@CaiyuZhang if no boxes are shown no objects are detected above `--conf` threshold.
@glenn-jocher Thanks for ur patient reply and  this amazing work.

@CaiyuZhang you can run detect on this image using pretrained weights like this:

`python3 detect.py --cfg yolov3-spp.cfg --weights yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt
`

The pretrained model is trained on 120,000 coco images for 300 epochs:
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/README.md#reproduce-our-results
@glenn-jocher ok, I will have a try, thanks a lot.

@glenn-jocher  I run `python3 detect.py --cfg yolov3-spp.cfg --weights yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt`
and I have manually downloaded the pt file and put it in weights directory, but why it still want to download again?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54944384/78852832-fcc51180-7a4f-11ea-9159-eb5e2c8c5938.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54944384/78852723-b96aa300-7a4f-11ea-8b80-f23cc5defea3.png)

@glenn-jocher I then run`python3 detect.py --cfg yolov3-spp.cfg --weights weights/yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt`. It doesn't download weights anymore, but it lead to annother mismatch error. Because I have changed yolov3-spp.cfg yolo classes and filters to train my custom data, but the weights of `yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt ` mismatch the cfg file, is my analysis trueï¼Ÿ
